data.question: What is the empirical formula and formula weight of the compound referred to as KD6?
What are the crystal system and space group for the compound KD5?
What is the temperature at which the crystal data for KD6 was collected?
What are the unique data and observed reflections for the compound referred to as KD5?
What is the final R indices (all data) for the compound KD6?
What are the bond lengths between Mn-N and Mn-O in compound KD5?
Based on the synthesis conditions, which two compounds were formed in the presence of MeOH?
What is the significance of the δ(C-H) mode in the IR spectrum for identifying structural variations of [TCNQ]-• in compounds 1 and 2?
data.answer: The δ(C-H) mode helps in detecting the presence of σ-dimerized [TCNQ]-• and differentiating between structural variations of [TCNQ]-• in compounds 1 and 2.

data.question: True or False: The compound [Mn(TCNQ)(TCNQ-TCNQ)0.5(MeOH)2]∞ exhibits Curie-Weiss behavior over the temperature range of 5 to 300 K.
True or False: The compound Mn(TCNQ)2(MeOH)2 exhibits diamagnetic behavior between 5 and 300 K.
True or False: The IR spectrum of compound 1 exhibits a δ(C-H) mode at 806 cm-1, indicating the presence of only [TCNQ-TCNQ]2-.
True or False: The synthesis of Mn(TCNQ)2(MeOH)2 and [Mn(TCNQ-TCNQ)(MeOH)2·MeOH]∞ requires the use of acetonitrile as the solvent.
True or False: The compound [Mn(TCNQ)(TCNQ-TCNQ)0.5(MeOH)2]∞ has a higher magnetic moment than Mn(TCNQ)2(MeOH)2 due to the presence of one [TCNQ]-• radical per Mn(II) ion.
